Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.check

Class CommonGetters

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.check.CommonGetters
public class CommonGetters
extends Object
Defines various functions that retrieve some oft-used property of a well-known class. For example: Object::toString. They can optionally be used as the first argument to the various has(...) methods of the Check class. The advantage of using these functions rather than the method references they return is that they are already associated with the name of the property they expose, so generating an error message requires very little hand-crafting. For example: 

 Check.that(car, "car").has(stringValue(), equalTo(), "BMW");
 // Error message: "car.toString() must be equal to BMW (was Toyota)"

Some functions, are in fact not really getters (no-arg methods called on the argument), but rather single-argument methods which get passed the argument. For example: 

 Check.that(temperature, "temperature").has(abs(), lt(), 20);
 // Error message: "abs(temperature) must be < 20 (was -39)"

Most methods in this class return plain method references. None of them do a preliminary null-check on the argument. They rely upon being embedded within in chain of checks on a Check object, the first of which should be a not-null check.

Author:
Ayco Holleman

      public static <L extends List<?>> ToIntFunction<L> listSize()
